message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the asymptotic performance of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in communication systems. The paper focuses on the construction of a polarizing matrix using the Kronecker product, which is a mathematical operation commonly used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves matrix algebra and optimization, which are relevant to cs.SI (Systems and Control) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper's focus on the design of a large polarizing matrix suggests that it may also be relevant to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
